entry.title: Combined summary - Radpool: Decentralised Mining Pool With Futures Contracts For Payouts
entry.summary:
Radpool introduces a revolutionary approach to combat the centralization of mining by establishing a syndicate of Mining Service Providers (MSPs). This innovative framework decentralizes the generation of block templates, challenging the conventional centralized mining pool model. By enabling MSPs to independently construct block templates and manage stratum servers, Radpool empowers miners with greater flexibility and control over their mining operations. Utilizing Free Open Source Software (FOSS) allows for diverse node implementations within the ecosystem, further promoting decentralization.
The platform's payout mechanism is another significant innovation, utilizing Discreet Log Contracts (DLCs) to facilitate miner compensation based on their contributed hash rate at set intervals. This ensures stable and reliable payouts, as MSPs fund these contracts and settle them through FROST threshold signatures. The Pay-Per-Last-N-Shares (PPLNS) scheme used for distributing rewards from pooled blocks minimizes variance in block discovery and guarantees miner payouts, preventing unilateral withdrawal by MSPs. Such a system not only enhances the stability of the Radpool ecosystem but also opens up opportunities for entities capable of funding DLC contracts to operate as MSPs, potentially earning yields by attracting miners.
Radpool strategically positions itself between traditional centralized pools and peer-to-peer (p2p) pools, forming an open syndicate of MSPs that maintain the operational familiarity of centralized pools while incorporating the benefits of decentralization. This balance aims to reduce variance for miners and increase yield opportunities for MSPs, fostering a competitive market for pool fees and encouraging network expansion through a classic network effect.
Key features of Radpool include decentralized block template construction, futures contract-based payments to miners via DLCs, use of Radpool as an oracle for MSP attestation generation, transparent share accounting, and facilitated exits for both miners and MSPs. These innovations ensure a seamless transition for miners accustomed to centralized pools, negating the need for additional services on their part.
Currently, the focus is on developing the FROST Federation, which underpins the federation of MSPs, alongside the initial stages of implementing DLC contracts using Rust-DLC. The community is encouraged to participate in discussions on Discord to identify potential vulnerabilities and contribute to the project's ongoing development.
